page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY:BED'HM:HED'HM
page.content: Both parishes have Saxon names,in 1086 they were written Bedingaham-the home of Beda's people-& Hedenaham,Hedena's ham;but earlier peoples are evidenced by Roman Stone Street,the B1332,which runs thro' from Woodton to Halesworth. A Bedingham manor & the parish church were owned by the Augustinian canons of Walsingham Priory from C13 to the dissolution of the monasteries.This accounts for the fine church,so large for a small parish & the eponymous nearby Priory Farm.C17 Hedenham Hall was built for the Bedingfields,'Lords of the Manor' & Hedenham's pub owes its name - the Mermaid -to the Garnays of Hedenham,whose coat of arms feat- ures that creature.Sexton Wood & near- by farmland is crisscrossed by useful concrete roads with loading bays,rel- ics of the 1939-45 war,when the wood was a bomb-store for local airfields.
